channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: Hackers takeover Azuki’s Twitter account, steal over $750K in less than 30 minutes
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ciaran Lyons
item.description: The majority of the funds stolen were from a single wallet which had $751,321.80 USDC drained from the malicious link.

item.title: California DMV to digitize car title management system via Tezos
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: California DMV’s chief digital officer Ajay Gupta emphasized that the agency is looking to modernize its current systems and bring greater transparency to car title transfers.

item.title: Total crypto market cap rises above $1T, and data suggests more upside is in store
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Pechman
item.description: Bad news continues to dominate crypto media headlines but Bitcoin and the wider market appear to not care.

item.title: Fed policy to align bank oversight could limit crypto activities by state banks
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: The new policy would align the allowable activities for insured and uninsured state banks and OCC-supervised national banks by making rules for state banks more restrictive.

item.title: 5 reasons why the Aptos (APT) rally could still have wings
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Nivesh Rustgi
item.description: Aptos’ star-studded founders and the market’s disbelief in the rally could further fuel the rise in APT price.

item.title: Aave deploys V3 on Ethereum after 10 months of testing on other networks
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: The new version includes features that developers believe will increase capital efficiency and lower gas fees

item.title: Price analysis 1/27: BTC, ETH, BNB, XRP, ADA, DOGE, MATIC, DOT, LTC, AVAX
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Rakesh Upadhyay
item.description: Bitcoin and select altcoins continue to consolidate near their recent highs, increasing the possibility of an upside breakout.

item.title: New Ripple president says her job is to continue to scale amid crypto winter
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: Veteran Ripple executive and former general manager Monica Long said the company has seen record growth in recent months despite the crypto winter.

item.title: TradFi and DeFi come together at Davos 2023: Finance Redefined
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: Decentralized finance meets its traditional counterpart at Davos, with a growing cross-pollination between the two.

item.title: New York Assembly introduces crypto payments bill for fines, taxes
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: The bill clarifies that state agencies can legally agree to accept cryptocurrency payments and that these agreements should be enforced by the courts.

item.title: Opinion: 3 tips for trading Ethereum this year
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Daniel O'Keeffe
item.description: It’s a hard year to trade, but there are measures you can take to increase the likelihood you’ll succeed if you want to trade Ether.

item.title: Crypto Biz: A peek into BlockFi’s secret financials (it’s not pretty)
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Sam Bourgi
item.description: How much exposure does BlockFi have to Sam Bankman-Fried failed enterprises? A lot, according to accidentally leaked financials.

item.title: Bitcoin will hit $200K before $70K ‘bear market’ next cycle — Forecast
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: Stochastic patterns leave the door open for 189% BTC price gains versus the current Bitcoin all-time high, according to one analyst.

item.title: Solana DeFi project Friktion shuts down its user platform
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: Friktion is urging its customers to withdraw assets from the protocol as the front-end shuts down.

item.title: The state of Solana: Will the layer-1 protocol rise again in 2023?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marco Castrovilli
item.description: Despite the latest FTX-related crisis, Solana still has what it takes to win the layer-1 race, according to the head of strategy at the Solana Foundation, Austin Federa.

item.title: Fed denies Custodia Bank application to join the Federal Reserve System
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: The bank applied for the application in 2019 and sued the Fed in an attempt to speed up the decision.

item.title: Litecoin ‘head fake’ rally? LTC price technicals hint at 65% crash
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Yashu Gola
item.description: LTC price could drop alongside riskier assets as macro analysts sound a bull trap alarm over this potential “head fake” recovery.

item.title: Here’s how the World Economic Forum leaps into the metaverse — Davos 2023
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Gareth Jenkinson
item.description: Industry insiders highlight World Economic Forum workshops on the metaverse focusing on user privacy, asset protection and regulation.

item.title: Creating self-sovereignty in the creator economy and Web3 — Is there room for both?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Alyssa Exposito
item.description: NFT Steez sits down with Web3 advocate Julie Plavnik to discuss the concepts of self-sovereignty and digital identity in Web3-based creator economies.

item.title: FTX lawyers to reap millions from the bankruptcy case: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Helen Partz
item.description: FTX’s legal team from Sullivan & Cromwell has 150 people on the bankruptcy case, with thirty partners reportedly charging more than $2,000 per hour.

item.title: State senator pushes bill to make Bitcoin legal tender in Arizona
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: The state senator also introduced a similar bill to make Bitcoin legal tender in 2022 but did not succeed.

item.title: What is an ascending triangle pattern and how to trade it?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Yashu Gola
item.category: What is an ascending triangle pattern
item.description: Ascending triangle patterns are one of the most popular chart indicators traders use, but it does not always mean the price will rally.

item.title: US institutions account for 85% of Bitcoin buying in ‘very positive sign’ — Matrixport
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ciaran Lyons
item.description: Matrixport’s head of research and strategy suggests the industry will soon see layer 1 and other altcoins outperforming relative to Bitcoin.

item.title: US securities regulator probes Wall Street over crypto custody: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brayden Lindrea
item.description: According to sources, the regulator has been probing registered investment advisers over how they’ve offered crypto custody to their clients.

item.title: Argo Blockchain accused of misleading investors in class-action lawsuit
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Luke Huigsloot
item.description: After a torrid 2022 that saw it sell off its flagship mining facility, Argo Blockchain’s woes are worsening after a recent class-action suit.

item.title: Bitcoin miner Hut 8 takes stoush with Ontario power supplier to court
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: The lawsuit escalates a months-long dispute between the crypto miner and one of its energy suppliers in Canada.

item.title: Congressman Hill to ‘make sure’ US is the place for blockchain innovation
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Martin Young
item.description: The chair of the Financial Services Subcommittee on Digital Assets wants to make America the place for fintech and blockchain innovation.

item.title: Leaked bids: Binance, Galaxy Digital among secret bidders for Celsius assets
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ciaran Lyons
item.description: Crypto blogger Tiffany Fong has shared documents she claims to have obtained in late December detailing several bids for Celsius’ crypto assets.

item.title: UK’s FCA hints at why it’s only given 15% of crypto firms the regulatory nod
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brayden Lindrea
item.description: The UK financial watchdog has received 300 crypto firm registration applications but has approved only 41 applicants.

item.title: CFTC’s Johnson urges Congress to expand commission’s crypto oversight powers
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Luke Huigsloot
item.description: Commodity Futures Trading Commission Kristin Johnson wants to protect customers in a way that reduces the risk of future crises.
